direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods search for elements based on a specific attribute (tag name vs. class name) and return a collection of matching elements.
Both methods search for elements based on a specific attribute (tag name vs. ID) and return a single matching element or a collection.
Both methods search for elements based on a specific attribute (tag name vs. any attribute) and return a collection of matching elements.
Both methods can be used to select elements based on a query, but `select` uses CSS selectors while `getElementsByTag` uses a direct tag name.
Both methods can be used to select elements based on a query, but `selectXpath` uses XPath expressions while `getElementsByTag` uses a direct tag name.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require initialization of a parser or selector mechanism before performing the search.
Environment setup is required before performing the search operation, ensuring the DOM is ready.
Both methods may need to handle exceptions or invalid inputs similarly, ensuring the search operation is robust.
